enumParam.name: RodMalStage
enumParam.prompt: Stage in which phenotype is observed
enumParam.help: Select the lifecycle stage in which you want to look for phenotype changes

enumParam.name: RodMalType
enumParam.help: Select gene modification by mutation or disruption

enumParam.name: RodMalSuccess
enumParam.help: Select whether the modification was successful or not

enumParam.name: RodMalPhenotype
enumParam.help: Select the effect on the phenotype from not different to wild-type, changed from wild-type or not tested. Specifics of phenotype changes can be viewed on the gene record pages

enumParam.name: protein_coding_only
enumParam.help: Should only protein coding genes be returned?

stringParam.name: single_gene_id
stringParam.help: Enter the ID for the gene that you wish to query.

stringParam.name: min_mutual_information_score
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum mutual information score to report similarities. The score range is from 0.472 to 1.67

stringParam.name: min_num_query_matches
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum number of queries you want to match to your genes. If you input 5 genes ids for your query and enter 5 minimum number of queries then the only genes returned would be ones that all 5 queries match

flatVocabParam.name: tfbs_name
flatVocabParam.help: The image displayed below indicates the binding site for the chosen transcription factor.

stringParam.name: tfbs_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the center of the peak to be from the 5' end of the gene. Note that the larger the value entered here (3000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

enumParam.name: tfbs_pvalue
enumParam.help: The p value cutoff for this search. The P value is the probability that the binding site with that score would match at that position given the input DNA (inter-genic and telomeric regions). For example, a P value of 1X10<sup>-4</sup> means that you would find a match that good every 10,000 basepairs on average on that strand.

enumParam.name: tfbs_num_sites
enumParam.help: Choose the minimum number of sites per gene that meet your other criteria.

enumParam.name: tfbs_direction
enumParam.prompt: Binding Site location relative to 5' end of gene
enumParam.help: Choose whether the peak should be upstream or downstream of the 5' end of the gene.

stringParam.name: chip_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the center of the peak to be from the 5' end of the gene. Note that the larger the value entered here (3000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

stringParam.name: chip_score
stringParam.help: The score for a peak is the average of the normalized log ratio values for all the probes covered in the peak (the log ratio value of the probe used in computing the average is normalized with respect to all the probes).

enumParam.name: chip_reps
enumParam.help: Choose the number of peaks for this antibody/treatment. Note that the PLK (TypeII) strain was only done with one replicate. Note that this is the total number of peaks per antibody/treatment pair.

enumParam.name: chip_direction
enumParam.prompt: Peak location relative to 5' end of gene
enumParam.help: Choose whether the peak should be upstream or downstream of the 5' end of the gene.

flatVocabParam.name: chip_strains
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a strain from which the samples were prepared.

flatVocabParam.name: chip_antibody_toxo
flatVocabParam.help: Choose an Antibody

flatVocabParam.name: chip_replicates
flatVocabParam.help: Choose 'Yes' if you would like to fetch genes that have evidence from both replicates.

flatVocabParam.name: chip_replicates_plasmo
flatVocabParam.help: Choose 'Yes' if you would like to fetch genes that have evidence from both replicates.

flatVocabParam.name: chip_experiment
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a ChIP on chip assay/experiment

flatVocabParam.name: chip_antibody_plasmo
flatVocabParam.help: Choose an Antibody

flatVocabParam.name: chip_genotypes
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a Genotype

flatVocabParam.name: metabolic_pathway_id

stringParam.name: st_max_five_prime_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the tag to be from the 5' end of the gene. This is assuming that the gene model does not contain the entire transcribed region which is frequently the case. Note that the larger the value entered here (1000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

stringParam.name: st_max_three_prime_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the tag to be from the 3' end of the gene. This is assuming that the gene model does not contain the entire transcribed region which is frequently the case. Note that the larger the value entered here (1000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

stringParam.name: st_min_tag_count
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum frequency of the SAGE tags meeting your criteria. Tags must have this minimum frequency in at least one selected SAGE library.

stringParam.name: st_max_occurrences
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum number of times the sequence for this SAGE tag is present in the genome.

enumParam.name: sense_antisense
enumParam.help: Choose whether to consider SAGE tags which are sense or antisense relative to the genes returned.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_product
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with new gene product names since the last @PROJECT_ID@ release.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_ec
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with altered EC numbers since the last @PROJECT_ID@ release.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_go
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with altered Gene Ontology (GO) assignments since the last @PROJECT_ID@ release.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_cds

enumParam.help: Choose which genes to return based on their change in status from old to new annotation.

stringParam.name: sage_tag_min_r
stringParam.help: Choose a minimum R value to be returned. Stekel et al.â€™s R-statistic (Stekel, Git, and Falciani 2000) scores SAGE tags on differential expression among libraries (more variable tags have higher R values), with no assignment of significance values.

flatVocabParam.name: ec_number_pattern
flatVocabParam.help: Enzyme Commission numbers describe enzymes hierarchically by the class of reactions they catalyze. Begin typing an EC number or name to see a list of all possible EC categories that match what you have typed. Then choose an EC category from the list. Use '-' as a wildcard in place of numbers to denote partial EC Numbers.

stringParam.name: ec_wildcard
stringParam.help: Asterisks can be used as wildcard characters in an EC Number (e.g. "1.*")

flatVocabParam.name: ec_source
flatVocabParam.help: @ProjectID integrates EC numbers from several sources. EC assignments from more than one source may be queried in a single search. Select any or all EC number sources.

stringParam.help:
Exon count = exons/gene:

stringParam.name: num_exons_lte

stringParam.name: p_value
stringParam.prompt: P value less than or equal to
stringParam.help: The p value cutoff for this search. The p value for the gene indicates the significance of the difference in sequence coverage for the comparison selected. (p values were estimated using the Fisher's Exact Test). When more than one sample is chosen, the highest and the lowest p value for a gene across multiple samples is reported.

stringParam.name: confidence
stringParam.help: PaGE reports 1 - False Discovery Rate (FDR), which is called the "confidence" for the predictions. The FDR of a set of predictions is the expected percent of false predictions in the set of predictions. For example if the algorithm returns 100 genes with a false discovery rate of .3 (confidence=0.7) then we should expect 70 of them to be correct.

stringParam.name: false_discovery_rate
stringParam.help: The FDR of a set of predictions is the expected percent of false predictions. For example, if the algorithm returns 100 genes with a false discovery rate of .3, then 70 of them are expected to be correct.

stringParam.name: fold_change_cov
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: fold difference is reported in the summary as positive numbers for genes with greater coverage in the comparison than reference sample and negative numbers for genes with lesser coverage in the comparison than the reference sample

stringParam.name: fold_change
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: fold difference is reported in the summary as positive numbers for up-regulated genes and negative numbers for down-regulated genes

stringParam.name: fold_difference
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: Fold difference is reported in the summary as positive numbers for up-regulated genes and negative numbers for down-regulated genes

stringParam.name: minimum_percentile_value
stringParam.help: Enter a number for the minimum percentile value that the selected samples must meet in order to be included in the fold difference calculation. Note: this value is the minimum of the reference if down-regulated or the comparator if up-regulated.

stringParam.name: correlation
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: Correlation is reported in the summary as positive numbers for positively correlated genes and negative numbers for negatively correlated genes

flatVocabParam.name: regulated_dir_coverage
flatVocabParam.help: For ConditionA vs. ConditionB, select 'increase in coverage' for genes where ConditionA > ConditionB and select 'decrease in coverage' for genes where ConditionB > ConditionA.

flatVocabParam.name: regulated_dir
flatVocabParam.help:
• - Select 'up-regulated' to find genes that have higher expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

  • - Select 'down-regulated' to find genes that have lower expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

  • - Select 'up or down regulated' to find genes that have higher or lower expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

flatVocabParam.name: regulated_dir_immune_response
flatVocabParam.help:
• - Select 'increased immunogenicity' to find genes that have higher expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

  • - Select 'decreased immunogenicity' to find genes that have lower expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

  • - Select 'increased or decreased immunogenicity' to find genes that have higher or lower expression in the comparator as compared to the reference.

enumParam.name: regulated_dir_up_down_only
enumParam.help: Select up-regulated for genes where Reference < Comparison and select down-regulated for genes where Reference > Comparison. Note that when selecting up-regulated, the minimum value of samples selected in Reference will be used and reported and the maximum value of samples in Comparison. The opposite is true if down-regulated is selected.

enumParam.name: group_operator
enumParam.help: Choose the operation to use if you select multiple samples. Choosing minimum / maximum if doing up-regulated will use the minimum of the Reference and the maximum of the Comparison to calculate fold difference (opposite for down-regulated). Choosing average will use the average of the samples selected in each group to calculate the fold difference.

enumParam.name: fold_change_operator
enumParam.help: Choose the operation (min/max/average) to be applied when genes have multiple fold difference values (due to comparison with different samples/time points). This parameter only makes a difference if more than one sample/time point is chosen.

flatVocabParam.name: min_max_avg_comp

flatVocabParam.name: min_max_avg_ref
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the operation (min/max/average) to be applied to the chosen sample(s). This parameter only makes a difference if more than one sample/time point is chosen.

flatVocabParam.name: operation_no_dependency_comp
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the operation (min/max/average/med) to be applied to the chosen sample(s). This parameter only makes a difference if more than one sample/time point is chosen. Average is selected by default

flatVocabParam.name: operation_no_dependency_ref
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the operation (min/max/average/med) to be applied to the chosen sample(s). This parameter only makes a difference if more than one sample/time point is chosen. Average is selected by default

enumParam.name: apply_scaling

enumParam.name: correlation_dir

stringParam.name: percentile
stringParam.help: Expression percentile reflects the expression level of one gene compared to other genes from the same array for one time point. Genes are returned if ANY time point in the series has a percentile above the chosen value.

stringParam.name: min_tm
stringParam.help: Enter the upper limit of the range of transmembrane domain count that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products predicted to have no greater than this number of transmembrane domains.

stringParam.name: max_tm
stringParam.help: Enter the lower limit of the range of transmembrane domain count that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products predicted to have at least this number of transmembrane domains.

stringParam.name: min_sigp_sum_score
stringParam.help: SignalP-NN (neural network) provides four scores and a conclusion for each such that the conclusion is 1 if the score meets a certain criteria and 0 otherwise. The SignalP summary conclusion is the sum of the four conclusions generated by SignalP, thus four is the highest score possible. We consider a summary conclusion score of three to be significant

stringParam.name: min_sigp_d_score
stringParam.help: The D-score is the average of the S-mean and Y-max score from SignalP-NN

stringParam.name: min_sigp_signal_probability
stringParam.help: Signal Probability from SignalP-HMM

flatVocabParam.name: geneType
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more gene types. Genes returned by this search will have gene products of your selected type (or types).

Select one or more gene types. Genes returned by this search will have gene products of your selected type (or types).

The gene type called 'Repeat region' refers to the most common 59 repeat families identified in the assembly. They constitute ~39 Mb of the genome and can be classified as (1) virus-like; (2) transposon-like; (3) retrotransposon-like; and (4) unclassified (no similarity to known proteins; peptide motifs; or nucleotide sequences). Most are present in hundreds of copies (average ~660) and each family is extraordinarily homogenous; with a ~2.5% average polymorphism.

Select one or more gene types. Genes returned by this search will have gene products of your selected type (or types).

Choose whether to include pseudogenes in your query results.

Pseudogenes are dysfunctional genes that no longer encode protein or are no longer expressed, usually due to the accumulation of mutations.

Use this parameter to indicate the GO Term (e.g. "catalytic activity") or GO ID (e.g. "GO:0003824") that you wish to query for. Genes returned by this search are annotated with the GO Term or ID you indicate here.</br></br>
Begin typing a GO Term or ID to see a list of all possible categories that match what you have typed. Then choose a Term/ID from the list. You can choose more than onee using CTRL- or CMD-click when choosing the domains. Or paste a list of domain IDs separated by a comma, new line, white space or semicolon. Any unkown IDs will be marked as not found

stringParam.help:

Type the text term you wish to find, including an asterisk wildcard for ambiguous portions of your text term. (*ase, kin*, *kinase*) The search will query for all GO Terms and IDs that contain your text.

stringParam.name: min_searches

enumParam.name: BlastDatabaseType
enumParam.help: The type of the target database (eg CDS, Transcripts, Proteins)

enumParam.name: epitope_confidence
enumParam.help: Epitopes are mapped to genes in @PROJECT_ID@ using high quality BLAST similarities (percent identity >= 97%) between the GenBank proteins listed on IEDB and the proteins found in @PROJECT_ID@, and exact string matching. Confidence levels are assigned to each set of epitopes based on the quality of this mapping. A high confidence is assigned to a set where all of the epitopes are found on a given BLAST hit. A medium confidence is assigned to a set where either some, but not all, of the epitopes in a set are found on a given BLAST hit, or where all of the epitopes in a set are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified as a match by BLAST. A low confidence is assigned to sets where some, but not all, of the epitopes are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified by BLAST. Choose one or more assigned confidence levels to search for epitopes in.

enumValue.internal: 'Full Set Not on Blast Hit','Not Full Set On Blast Hit'

enumParam.name: expressionPct
enumParam.help: Expression percentile reflects the expression level of one gene compared to other genes from the same array for one time point. Genes are returned if ANY time point in the series has a percentile above the chosen value.

stringParam.name: max_molecular_weight

stringParam.name: excluded_species

stringParam.name: min_exportpred_score
stringParam.help:
Enter a mininum ExportPred score that must be assigned to a gene before it is returne dby this search.

A score threshold of 4.3 corresponds to a 5% FDR, meaning that we expect 5% of the resulting set of ExportPred predictions above this threshold to be false positives.

enumParam.name: asexual_blood_stages_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: gametocytes_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: sporozoites_value

enumParam.name: liberal_conservative
enumParam.help: Select if Liberal or Conservative co-ordinates for haplotype blocks are to be used. A Conservative estimate of a haplotype block starts at the first microsatellite to map within the region and ends at the last microsatellite to map in the region. A Liberal estimate of a haplotype block starts at the end of the last microsatellite that was mapped in the previous haplotype block region and ends at the beginning of the first microsatellite mapped in the next haplotype block region. Both estimates are provided because of the lack of accurate co-ordinates of where exactly the cross-over event happened.

stringParam.name: min_interaction
stringParam.help: Set a minimum for the likelihood of interaction

flatVocabParam.name: ms_assay
flatVocabParam.help: Click the + to select specific samples or use the tree box to select all samples for a given experiment.

stringParam.name: genbank_accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank Accession number

stringParam.name: distanceFromTelomere
stringParam.help:
Define the size of the genomic region you wish to query by entering the 'Maximum Distance from Telomere'.

For each chromsome you have chosen, the search will query for genes that overlap two genomic regions. Each genomic region has size equal to your distance but one begins at the start of the chromosome and one begins at the end of the chromosome.

stringParam.name: max_centromere_distance
stringParam.help:
Define the query region by entering a distance (in nucleotides) from the centromere.

The search queries two regions. Each region is the size of your Max Distance but is located on the opposite side of the centromere.

Genes between the centromere and the Maximum Distance from Centromere will be returned by the search.

enumParam.name: start_from
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the start point from the beginning or end of the sequence

enumParam.name: end_from
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence

enumParam.name: protein_dataset
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence

stringParam.name: pvalue_cutoff
stringParam.prompt: BLAST P-value less than 10 to the
stringParam.help: Only consider BLAST similarities with a P-value less than ten to the given power.

flatVocabParam.name: clades
flatVocabParam.prompt: With similarity to PDB Proteins from
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more clades.

stringParam.name: accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank, RefSeq, or SwissProt accession number

stringParam.name: min_coil
stringParam.help: Enter the lower limit (percentage) for the range of coil content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content at least this percentage coil.

stringParam.name: max_coil
stringParam.help: Enter the upper limit (percentage) for the range of coil content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content no greater than this percentage coil.

stringParam.name: min_strand
stringParam.help: Enter the lower limit (percentage) for the range of strand content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content of at least this percentage strand.

stringParam.name: max_strand
stringParam.help: Enter the upper limit (percentage) for the range of strand content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content no greater than this percentage strand.

stringParam.name: min_helix
stringParam.help: Enter the lower limit (percentage) for the range of helix content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content of at least this percentage helix.

stringParam.name: max_helix
stringParam.help: Enter the upper limit (percentage) for the range of helix content that you wish to query. Genes returned by this search will have protein products with secondary structure content no greater than this percentage helix.

stringParam.name: ProfileGeneId
stringParam.help: Gene Id for which genes with a similar expression profile are to be fetched.

enumParam.name: ProfileDistanceMethod
enumParam.help: The method used to calculate the similarity distance

stringParam.name: ProfileNumToReturn
stringParam.help: The number of genes in the result

stringParam.name: ProfileMissingPtsPercent
stringParam.help: Percentage of missing data points permissible

enumParam.name: ProfileSearchGoal
enumParam.help: Type of correlation the search should look for

flatVocabParam.name: profile_profile_set
flatVocabParam.help: Choose an experiment for this search

flatVocabParam.name: profile_time_shift
flatVocabParam.help: The minimum time by which the similarity of expression profile of a gene can be shifted in time when compared to the input gene's profile (Hence, selecting 0 would return profiles that closely match the profile of the input gene Id).

enumParam.name: text_fields
enumParam.help: Choose which text fields to search.

stringParam.name: max_pvalue
stringParam.prompt: Max p-value exponent (BLAST Hits v. NRDB)
stringParam.help: Only applicable to the 'Similar proteins' field. Use this to filter away BLAST hits that are below a threshold of significance, so you only search the descriptions of significantly similar proteins.

stringParam.name: e_value
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum E value allowed to report domain matches.

flatVocabParam.name: domain_database
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one of the constituent databases of InterPro.

flatVocabParam.name: domain_typeahead
flatVocabParam.help:
Use this parameter to indicate the domain you wish to query for. Genes returned by this search have protein products that are predicted to contain the domain(s) you indicate here.

Begin typing a domain name, accession or description, to see a list of all possible domains that match what you have typed. Then choose a domain name from the list. You can choose multiple domains using CTRL- or CMD-click when choosing the domains.

Or paste a list of domain IDs separated by a comma, new line, white space or semicolon.

stringParam.name: domain_accession
stringParam.help:
Use this parameter to indicate the domain you wish to query for. Genes returned by this search have protein products that are predicted to contain the domain(s) you indicate here.

Type the text term you wish to find, including an asterisk wildcard for ambiguous portions of your text term. (*ase, kin*, *kinase*) The search will query for all domains whose names, accessions or descriptions contain your text.

enumParam.name: gl_exprnsample
enumParam.help: Choose one or more comparisons. Choosing more than one will result in the union of results.

enumParam.name: gl_exprnsample_two

enumParam.help: Numerator in Fold Difference Calculation. fold difference greater than 0 means the expression is higher in this sample

enumParam.name: lineages_b
enumParam.help: Denominator in Fold Difference Calculation. fold chage less than 0 means the expression is higher in this sample

enumParam.name: sample

enumParam.name: subType
enumParam.help: Genes with little or no evidence that overlapped (or were subsumed by) larger genes for which there was evidence such as protein similarities, expression evidence from EST alignments, SAGE or proteomics data were marked as deprecated. These genes will likely be removed in a subsequent release of GiardiaDB (and in GenBank) unless additional evidence is provided indicating they should be moved into the real gene category. Please add a user comment to those deprecated genes for which you have experimental evidence indicating that they are real.

flatVocabParam.name: nonnuclear_sequence
flatVocabParam.help: Nonnuclear genomic sequence of various Plasmodium organisms includes the sequence of the mitochondrial and apicoplast genomes.
Nonnuclear genomic sequence for T. gondii includes the sequence of the apicoplast genome.

Nonnuclear genomic sequence of various Plasmodium organisms includes the sequence of the mitochondrial and apicoplast genomes. Nonnuclear genomic sequence for T. gondii includes the sequence of the apicoplast genome.

sqlQuery.name: NonNuclearSequence
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT sa.source_id as internal, sa.source_id as term, so.term_name as display FROM apidbtuning.sequenceattributes sa, SRes.sequenceontology so WHERE sa.so_id = so.so_id AND so.term_name in ('mitochondrial_chromosome', 'apicoplast_chromosome') AND sa.organism = $$org_with_nonnuclear_genes$$ ORDER BY so.term_name

sqlQuery.name: ProfileTimeNoShift
sqlQuery.sql: select 0 as internal, 0 as term, 0 as display from dual

sqlQuery.name: ProfileTimeShift
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT num AS internal, num ||' hours' AS term, num ||' hours' AS display FROM (SELECT Rownum num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 24 UNION SELECT 0 num FROM dual UNION SELECT Rownum * (-1) num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 24 ) t ORDER BY t.num asc

SELECT num AS internal, num ||' hours' AS term, num ||' hours' AS display FROM (SELECT Rownum num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 6 UNION SELECT 0 num FROM dual UNION SELECT Rownum * (-1) num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 6 ) t ORDER BY t.num asc

SELECT num AS internal, num ||' hours' AS term, num ||' hours' AS display FROM (SELECT Rownum num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 36 UNION SELECT 0 num FROM dual UNION SELECT Rownum * (-1) num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 36 ) t WHERE mod(num,12) = 0 ORDER BY t.num asc
select 0 as internal, 0 as term, 0 as display from dual

sqlQuery.name: ProfileTimeShiftFerdig
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT num AS internal, num ||' hours' AS term, num ||' hours' AS display FROM (SELECT Rownum num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 18 UNION SELECT 0 num FROM dual UNION SELECT Rownum * (-1) num FROM dual CONNECT BY Rownum <= 18 ) t ORDER BY t.num asc

sqlQuery.name: ProfileProfileSet
sqlQuery.sql: select 'M.White Cell Cycle Microarray spline smoothed - Interpolated' as term, 'M.White Cell Cycle Microarray spline smoothed - Interpolated' as internal, 'M.White Cell Cycle Microarray spline smoothed - Interpolated' as display from dual
select 'Cparvum_RT_PCR_Kissinger' as term, 'Cparvum_RT_PCR_Kissinger' as internal, 'C. parvum post-infection semi quantitative Real Time PCR' as display from dual
select name as term, name as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset where name like 'DeRisi % Smoothed'
select name as term, name as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset where name like 'Murine macrophages infected by 25 different strains of T. gondii'

sqlQuery.name: Pviv_Timing
sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, replace(name, 'ZB Pvivax time series', 'Patient') as display from apidb.profileset where name like 'ZB Pvivax time series %'

sqlQuery.name: Pviv_Timing_Percentile
sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, replace(name, 'red percentile - ZB Pvivax time series', 'Patient') as display from apidb.profileset where name like 'red percentile - ZB Pvivax time series %'

sqlQuery.name: Pber_Waters_DOZI_Direct_Comp
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen,apidb.profileset ps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.name = 'P. berghei DOZI array data'

sqlQuery.name: Pber_Waters_DOZI_Percentile
sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, case when lower(name) like 'red%' then 'DOZI Knock-Out' when lower(name) like 'green%' then 'Wild Type' end as display from apidb.profileset where name like '%percentile - P. berghei DOZI array data'

sqlQuery.name: Pber_Waters_DOZI_Percentile_Sample
sqlQuery.sql: Select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, case when lower(ps.name) like 'red%' then 'DOZI Knock-Out' when lower(ps.name) like 'green%' then 'Wild Type' end as display from apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileElementName pen where ps.name like '%percentile - P. berghei DOZI array data' and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and pen.profile_set_id = '$$profileset_generic$$' order by element_order

sqlQuery.name: Pyoe_Kappe_Percentile
sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, 'Kappe - P. yoelli Liver Stages' as display from apidb.profileset where name like 'percentile - kappe_profiles_averaged_over_all_channels'

sqlQuery.name: ProfileProfileSetFerdig
sqlQuery.sql: select 'Profiles of DD2-HB3 expression from Ferdig' as term, 'Profiles of DD2-HB3 expression from Ferdig' as internal, 'Profiles of DD2-HB3 expression from Ferdig' as display from dual

sqlQuery.name: regulatedDirection
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT 'up or down regulated' as term, 'abs' as internal from dual UNION SELECT 'down-regulated' as term, '-' as internal from dual UNION SELECT 'up-regulated' as term, '+' as internal from dual

sqlQuery.name: regulatedDirRNAi
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT 'Decrease in coverage' as display, 'down-regulated' as term, '-' as internal from dual

sqlQuery.name: regulatedDirectionImmune
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT 'increased immunogenicity' as term, 'increased' as internal from dual UNION SELECT 'decreased immunogenicity' as term, 'decreased' as internal from dual

sqlQuery.name: PhyleticIndentMap
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT (level-1) as internal, three_letter_abbrev as term FROM apidb.orthomclTaxon WHERE parent_id IS NOT NULL AND lower(three_letter_abbrev) not in ('tgrh', 'pgal', 'prei') START WITH orthomcl_taxon_id = (select min(orthomcl_taxon_id) from apidb.orthomclTaxon) CONNECT BY parent_id = prior orthomcl_taxon_id ORDER BY depth_first_index ASC, level ASC, three_letter_abbrev ASC

sqlQuery.name: TfbsNames
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct bg.name as term, bg.name as internal from ApidbTuning.TFBSGene bg, sres.externaldatabase d, sres.externaldatabaserelease rel where d.name = 'pfal3D7_genomeFeature_Llinas_TransFactorBindingSites_GFF2_RSRC' and d.external_database_id = rel.external_database_id and rel.external_database_release_id = bg.external_database_release_id order by bg.name

sqlQuery.name: PhyleticTermMap
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT three_letter_abbrev as term, name as internal FROM apidb.orthomcltaxon WHERE lower(three_letter_abbrev) not in ('tgrh', 'pgal', 'prei') ORDER BY depth_first_index ASC, three_letter_abbrev ASC

sqlQuery.name: ChIPAntibodyToxo
sqlQuery.sql: select replace(display,' - none','') as display, internal as internal, term as term from (select distinct cpp.antibody||'|'||cpp.treatment as term, cpp.antibody||'|'||cpp.treatment as internal, CASE WHEN cpp.antibody in (select cpp.antibody from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams cpp where cpp.replicate = 2) THEN CASE WHEN cpp.antibody like 'H3K%' THEN '(1) '||cpp.antibody||' - '||cpp.treatment ELSE '(3) '||cpp.antibody END ELSE '(2) ' ||cpp.antibody||' - '||cpp.treatment||' - No Replicates ' END as display from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams cpp where cpp.strain = $$chip_strains$$ and cpp.antibody != 'H3K4me1' and cpp.protocol_type = 'called_peaks') order by display

sqlQuery.name: ChIPReplicates
sqlQuery.sql: select term,internal,display from (select 'Yes' as term, 1 as internal,'Yes' as display from (select count(distinct replicate) as replicates from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams where strain = $$chip_strains$$ and protocol_type = 'called_peaks') cpp where cpp.replicates > 1 union select 'No' as term, 0 as internal, 'No' as display from (select count(distinct replicate) as replicates from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams where strain = $$chip_strains$$ and protocol_type = 'called_peaks') cpp where cpp.replicates > 1 union select 'No' as term, 0 as internal, 'Not Applicable' as display from (select count(distinct replicate) as replicates from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams where strain = $$chip_strains$$ and protocol_type = 'called_peaks') cpp where cpp.replicates in (1,0)) order by display asc

sqlQuery.name: PlasmoChIPReplicates
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct decode(replicate, null, 'Not Applicable', 'Yes') as display, decode(replicate, null, 0, 1) as term, decode(replicate, null, 0, 1) as internal from APIDBTUNING.chipprotocolparams where protocol_type = 'called_peaks' and experiment_name = '$$chip_experiment$$' union select 'No' as display, 0 as term, 0 as internal from APIDBTUNING.chipprotocolparams where protocol_type = 'called_peaks' and replicate is not null and experiment_name = '$$chip_experiment$$'

sqlQuery.name: ChIPAntibodyPlasmo
sqlQuery.sql: select case when display like '%H3K4%' THEN display || ' (only wild type)' WHEN display like '%H4K20%' THEN display || ' (only wild type)' ELSE display END as display, term, internal from (select distinct NVL(antibody, 'Not Applicable') as display, NVL(antibody, 'Not Applicable') as term, NVL(antibody, 'Not Applicable') as internal from APIDBTUNING.chipprotocolparams where experiment_name = '$$chip_experiment$$' and protocol_type = 'called_peaks' )

sqlQuery.name: ChIPGenotype
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct replace(NVL(genotype, 'Not Applicable'), '_', ' ') as display, NVL(genotype, 'Not Applicable') as term, NVL(genotype, 'Not Applicable') as internal from APIDBTUNING.chipprotocolparams where experiment_name = '$$chip_experiment$$' and protocol_type = 'called_peaks'

sqlQuery.name: ChIp_Assays
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct cpp.strain as term, cpp.strain as internal, CASE WHEN cpp.strain = 'CTG' THEN 'CTG (TypeIII)' WHEN cpp.strain = 'RH' THEN 'RH (TypeI)' WHEN cpp.strain = 'PLK' THEN 'PLK (TypeII)' END as display from ApidbTuning.ChIPProtocolParams cpp where cpp.protocol_type = 'called_peaks' and cpp.strain is not null and cpp.strain != 'unknown'

sqlQuery.name: ChIp_Experiments
sqlQuery.sql: select term,internal,display from (select 'Histone modifications in wild type and Sir2 knock-outs' as term, 'pfal3D7_Artur_Scherf' as internal,'(1) Histone modifications in wild type and Sir2 knock-outs' as display from dual union select 'Genome-wide assoc. of (Hp-1) with virulence gene clusters' as term, 'pfal3D7_Till_Voss' as internal, '(2) Genome-wide assoc. of Hp-1 with virulence gene clusters' as display from dual) order by display asc

sqlQuery.name: PFTimeSeriesPctProfileSet
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, replace((replace (p.name,'red percentile - DeRisi','iRBC')),'Smoothed','(48 Hour scaled)') as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name in ('red percentile - DeRisi 3D7 Smoothed','red percentile - DeRisi Dd2 Smoothed','red percentile - DeRisi HB3 Smoothed') order by name desc

sqlQuery.name: PFTimeSeriesFoldChangeProfileSet
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, replace((replace (p.name,'DeRisi','iRBC')),'Smoothed','(48 Hour scaled)') as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name in ('DeRisi 3D7 Smoothed','DeRisi Dd2 Smoothed','DeRisi HB3 Smoothed') order by name desc

sqlQuery.name: PFTimeSeriesSamples
sqlQuery.sql: select display, term,internal,parentTerm,sortTerm from ( select to_number(pe.value) || ' Hour' as display, to_number(pe.value) || ' Hour' as term, apidb.tab_to_string(set(cast(COLLECT(to_char(pen.profile_element_name_id)) as apidb.varchartab)), ',') as internal, CASE WHEN to_number(pe.value) > 0 AND to_number(pe.value) <= 8 THEN 'Early Ring' WHEN to_number(pe.value) > 8 AND to_number(pe.value) <= 16 THEN 'Late Ring' WHEN to_number(pe.value) > 16 AND to_number(pe.value) <= 23 THEN 'Early Trophozoite' WHEN to_number(pe.value) > 23 AND to_number(pe.value) <= 30 THEN 'Late Trophozoite' WHEN to_number(pe.value) > 30 AND to_number(pe.value) <= 39 THEN 'Early Schizont' ELSE 'Late Schizont' END as parentTerm, to_number(pe.value) as sortTerm from apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profile tpp, apidb.profileset tpps, apidb.profileelement pe where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and pe.profile_id = tpp.profile_id and ps.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ and tpps.name = decode(ps.name, 'DeRisi 3D7 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for 3D7', 'red percentile - DeRisi 3D7 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for 3D7', 'DeRisi HB3 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for HB3', 'red percentile - DeRisi HB3 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for HB3', 'DeRisi Dd2 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for Dd2', 'red percentile - DeRisi Dd2 Smoothed', '48 Hour Cycle Timepoint Map for Dd2') and tpps.profile_set_id = tpp.profile_set_id and tpp.source_id = pen.name group by to_number(pe.value) UNION select '1-16 Hours' as display, 'Ring' as term, '-1' as internal, '' as parentTerm, -3 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '1-8 Hours' as display, 'Early Ring' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Ring' as parentTerm, -2 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '9-16 Hours' as display, 'Late Ring' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Ring' as parentTerm, -1 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '17-30 Hours' as display, 'Trophozoite' as term, '-1' as internal, '' as parentTerm, -2 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '17-23 Hours' as display, 'Early Trophozoite' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Trophozoite' as parentTerm, -2 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '24-30 Hours' as display, 'Late Trophozoite' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Trophozoite' as parentTerm, -1 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '31-48 Hours' as display, 'Schizont' as term, '-1' as internal, '' as parentTerm, -1 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '31-39 Hours' as display, 'Early Schizont' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Schizont' as parentTerm, -2 as sortTerm from dual UNION select '40-48 Hours' as display, 'Late Schizont' as term, '-1' as internal, 'Schizont' as parentTerm, -1 as sortTerm from dual ) order by to_number(sortTerm)

sqlQuery.name: MetbPathwaysList
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct n.description ||' ('|| n.name||')' as display, n.network_context_id as term, n.network_context_id as internal from apidb.networkContext n

sqlQuery.name: ToxoTSFCProfileSetFl
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'VEG CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions (extended)' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of VEG strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite inducing conditions : 2-6 days (by Florence Dzierszinski)' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions (extended)' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite inducing conditions : 2-14 days (by Florence Dzierszinski)'

sqlQuery.name: ToxoTSFCProfileSetFlPct
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'VEG CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions (extended)' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of VEG strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite inducing conditions : 2-6 days (by Florence Dzierszinski)' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions (extended)' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite inducing conditions : 2-14 days (by Florence Dzierszinski)'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeProfileSetPDPct
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'RH Alkaline Bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of RH delta-HXGPRT delta-UPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru Sodium Nitroprusside bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain sodium nitroprusside bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeProfileSetPD
sqlQuery.sql: select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'RH Alkaline Bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of RH delta-HXGPRT delta-UPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru Sodium Nitroprusside bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain sodium nitroprusside bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain CO2-starvation bradyzoite-inducing conditions' union select p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Pru Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions' as display from apidb.profileset p where p.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeOnePd
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where (($$ts_fc_profile_one_pd$$ = 0 and ps.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)') or $$ts_fc_profile_one_pd$$ != 0 and ps.profile_set_id = $$ts_fc_profile_one_pd$$) and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: CellCycleFoldChangeMW
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'M.White Cell Cycle Microarray spline smoothed' and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeTwoPd
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where (($$ts_fc_profile_two_pd$$ = 0 and ps.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)') or $$ts_fc_profile_two_pd$$ != 0 and ps.profile_set_id = $$ts_fc_profile_two_pd$$) and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeOneFl
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where (($$ts_fc_profile_one_fl$$ = 0 and ps.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)') or $$ts_fc_profile_one_fl$$ != 0 and ps.profile_set_id = $$ts_fc_profile_one_fl$$) and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeTwoFl
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where (($$ts_fc_profile_two_fl$$ = 0 and ps.name = 'expression profiles of Pru dHXGPRT strain Alkaline bradyzoite-inducing conditions (media pH 8.2)') or $$ts_fc_profile_two_fl$$ != 0 and ps.profile_set_id = $$ts_fc_profile_two_fl$$) and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeMatt
sqlQuery.sql: select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'expression profiles of T. gondii Matt_Tz-Bz time series'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesFoldChangeMattPct
sqlQuery.sql: select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'percentile - expression profiles of T. gondii Matt_Tz-Bz time series'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesBrady48Hr
sqlQuery.sql: select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'three Tgondii strains under both normal-tachyzoite and induced-bradyzoite conditions'

sqlQuery.name: TimeSeriesBrady48HrPct
sqlQuery.sql: select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'percentile - three Tgondii strains under both normal-tachyzoite and induced-bradyzoite conditions'

sqlQuery.name: EcNumberList
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ec.ec_number AS internal, ec.ec_number AS term, ec.ec_number || ' (' || ec.description || ')' AS display FROM sres.enzymeClass ec, ApidbTuning.TypeAheadCounts tac WHERE ec.ec_number = tac.option_id AND tac.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' UNION SELECT 'N/A' AS internal, 'N/A' AS term, 'N/A' AS display FROM dual

sqlQuery.name: EcNumberSource
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT evidence_code AS internal, CASE WHEN evidence_code = 'OrthoMCLDerived' THEN 'inferred from OrthoMCL' WHEN evidence_code = 'gb' THEN 'GenBank' WHEN evidence_code = 'Hagai' THEN 'MPMP' ELSE evidence_code END as term FROM dots.aaSequenceEnzymeClass

sqlQuery.name: EcNumberAllSources
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT 'all' as term, apidb.tab_to_string(set(cast(COLLECT('''' || evidence_code || '''') AS apidb.varchartab)), ', ') as internal FROM dots.aaSequenceEnzymeClass

sqlQuery.name: GoTermList
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT gt.go_id AS internal, gt.go_id AS term, gt.go_id || ' : ' || gt.name AS display, gt.minimum_level as min_level, length(gt.name) as len FROM sres.GoTerm gt, sres.gorelationship gr, dots.goassociation ga, ApidbTuning.TypeAheadCounts tac WHERE gt.go_term_id = gr.parent_term_id AND ga.go_term_id = gr.child_term_id AND tac.option_id = gt.go_id AND tac.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' UNION SELECT 'N/A' as internal, 'N/A' as term, 'N/A' as display, 9999 as min_level, 9999 as len FROM dual ORDER BY min_level, len

sqlQuery.name: MassAssay
sqlQuery.sql: WITH OrganismConstraint as ( select distinct ims.sample, ims.organism as organism, ''||dsp.display_Name|| ' (' || nvl(dsp.short_attribution,substr(dsc.name,(regexp_instr(dsc.name,' ',1,regexp_count(dsc.name,' '),1))))|| ')'||'' As Experiment_Display, case when dsp.dataset_name_pattern is null then dsp.name else ims.organism||'_'||dsp.dataset_name_pattern end as experiment, Ims.Project_Id, ims.Internal_Id, ims.sort_order from DOTS.massspecfeature msf, apidb.massspecsummary mss, sres.externaldatabase ed, sres.externaldatabaserelease edr, apidbTuning.massspecterms ims, apidbTuning.datasetPresenter dsp, apidbTuning.datasetNameTaxon dsnt, apidbTuning.datasetContact dsc where mss.mass_spec_summary_id = msf.source_id and msf.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id and edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id and ims.internal_id = ed.name||'|'||mss.sample_file and ed.name like (dsnt.name) and dsc.dataset_presenter_id = dsp.dataset_presenter_id and dsnt.dataset_presenter_id = dsp.dataset_presenter_id And Dsc.Is_Primary_Contact = '1' and ims.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@') select replace(replace(term,','),('''')) as term, replace(replace(parentTerm,','),('''')) as parentTerm, display as display, internal, sort_order, chars, nums from( select CASE WHEN mst.sample = mst.experiment THEN mst.experiment_display ELSE mst.sample END as display, CASE WHEN mst.sample = mst.experiment THEN mst.experiment||'_'||mst.organism ELSE mst.sample||'_'||mst.organism END as term, CASE WHEN mst.sample = mst.experiment THEN mst.organism ELSE mst.experiment END as parentTerm, mst.internal_id as internal, mst.sort_order as sort_order, REGEXP_REPLACE(mst.sample,'[0-9]','') as chars, to_number(REGEXP_REPLACE(mst.sample,'[^0-9]','')) as nums from OrganismConstraint mst where mst.experiment is not null union select mst.experiment_display as display, mst.experiment as term, mst.organism as parentTerm, '-1' as internal, mst.sort_order as sort_order, '' as chars, NULL as nums from OrganismConstraint mst where mst.experiment is not null and mst.experiment <> mst.sample union select ''|| mst.organism ||'' as display, mst.organism as term, substr(mst.organism,4,(instr(mst.organism,' ',1))-4) as parentTerm, '-1' as internal, mst.sort_order as sort_order, '' as chars, NULL as nums from OrganismConstraint mst where mst.experiment is not null and mst.experiment <> mst.sample union select ''||substr(mst.organism,4,(instr(mst.organism,' ',1))-4)||'' as display, substr(mst.organism,4,(instr(mst.organism,' ',1))-4) as term, '' as parentTerm, '-1' as internal, mst.sort_order as sort_order, '' as chars, NULL as nums from OrganismConstraint mst where mst.experiment is not null and mst.experiment <> mst.sample ) order by display

select replace(replace(term,','),('''')) as term, replace(replace(parentTerm,','),('''')) as parentTerm, term as display, internal from( select mst.sample as term, 'T. vaginalis subcellular fraction(Johnson)' as parentTerm, mst.internal_id as internal from apidbtuning.MassSpecTerms mst where mst.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' union select 'T. vaginalis subcellular fraction' as term, mst.organism as parentTerm, '-1' as internal from apidbtuning.MassSpecTerms mst where mst.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' union select mst.organism as term, mst.organism as parentTerm, '-1' as internal from apidbtuning.MassSpecTerms mst where mst.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' )

sqlQuery.name: DomainAccession
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT dr.primary_identifier AS internal, dr.primary_identifier || ' : ' || dr.secondary_identifier AS term, dr.primary_identifier || ' : ' || dr.secondary_identifier || ' ' || dr.remark AS display, lower(dr.secondary_identifier) AS secondary_identifier, lower(dr.remark) AS remark FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed, ApidbTuning.TypeAheadCounts tac WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND edr.external_database_release_id IN ($$domain_database$$) AND tac.option_id = dr.primary_identifier AND tac.project_id = '@PROJECT_ID@' UNION SELECT 'N/A', 'N/A', 'N/A', 'zzz', 'zzz' FROM dual ORDER BY secondary_identifier,remark

sqlQuery.name: GiardiaAnalyses
sqlQuery.sql: select a.analysis_id internal, replace(a.name, 'PaGE Analysis - ', '') as term from rad.ANALYSIS a, rad.PROTOCOL p where p.protocol_id = a.protocol_id and p.name = 'PaGE'

sqlQuery.name: GeneTypes
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct REPLACE(REPLACE(regexp_replace(ga.gene_type, 'non[ |_]protein[_| ]coding', 'misc RNA'), '_encoding', ''), '_', ' ') AS term, ga.gene_type as internal from ApidbTuning.GeneAttributes ga

sqlQuery.name: ExtraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct name AS term, name AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Sporozoite', 'Gametocyte') ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: ExtraerythrocyticStageRefe
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct name AS term, name AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name = 'Gametocyte' ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: ExtraerythrocyticStageComp
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct name AS term, name AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name = 'Sporozoite' ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: IntraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct name AS term, element_order AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Early Ring', 'Late Ring', 'Early Schizogony', 'Late Schizogony', 'Early Trophozoite', 'Late Trophozoite', 'Merozoite') ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: PlSynchronizationFldChnge
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.profile_set_id as internal, CASE WHEN p.name like '%_sorbExp' THEN 'Sorbitol' WHEN p.name like '%_tempExp' THEN 'Temperature' END as term FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name in ('winzeler_cc_sorbExp','winzeler_cc_tempExp')

sqlQuery.name: PlSynchronizationPercentile
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.profile_set_id as internal, CASE WHEN p.name like '%_sorbExp' THEN 'Sorbitol' WHEN p.name like '%_tempExp' THEN 'Temperature' END as term FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name in ('percentile - winzeler_cc_sorbExp','percentile - winzeler_cc_tempExp')

sqlQuery.name: WinzelerSexualFldChnge
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.profile_set_id as internal, p.name as term, 'Sexual Cycle Expression' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'winzeler_cc_sexExp'

sqlQuery.name: WinzelerSexualPercentile
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.profile_set_id as internal, p.name as term, 'Sexual Cycle Expression' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'percentile - winzeler_cc_sexExp'

sqlQuery.name: Reagents
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT term, internal FROM (SELECT reagent_type AS term, reagent_type AS internal, rownum AS ord FROM (SELECT DISTINCT lower(dr.secondary_identifier) AS reagent_type FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name in ('MR4DBxRefs','pfal3D7_dbxref_simple_gene2MR4Reagents_RSRC','AntibodyDBxRefs') ORDER BY lower(dr.secondary_identifier)) UNION SELECT 'any' AS term, 'any' AS internal, 0 AS ord FROM dual) ORDER BY ord

sqlQuery.name: gametocyteFldChngeStrain
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.profile_set_id as internal, CASE WHEN p.name like '%_3D7_MAC' THEN '3D7 MAC' WHEN p.name like '%_3D7_gametocyte' THEN '3D7 Gametocyte' WHEN p.name like '%_NF54_gametocyte' THEN 'NF54 Gametocyte' END as term FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name in (' winzeler_3D7_MAC', ' winzeler_3D7_gametocyte',' winzeler_NF54_gametocyte')

sqlQuery.name: Clades
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT tn.name AS term, taxon_id AS internal FROM sres.taxonname tn WHERE tn.name IN ('Archaea', 'Eukaryota', 'Bacteria') OR tn.name IN (select distinct term from APIDBTUNING.organismtree where parentterm is null) order by tn.name

sqlQuery.name: DomainDatabase
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT ed.name AS term, edr.external_database_release_id AS internal FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND dr.db_ref_id IN (SELECT draf.db_ref_id FROM dots.DomainFeature df, dots.DbRefAaFeature draf, core.AlgorithmInvocation ainv, core.AlgorithmImplementation aimp WHERE df.aa_feature_id = draf.aa_feature_id AND df.row_alg_invocation_id = ainv.algorithm_invocation_id AND ainv.algorithm_implementation_id = aimp.algorithm_implementation_id AND aimp.executable like 'ApiCommonData::Load::Plugin::InsertInterproscanResults%') ORDER BY term

sqlQuery.name: gametocytePercentStrain
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ps.profile_set_id AS internal, DECODE(ps.name, 'percentile - winzeler_NF54_gametocyte', 'Strain NF54', 'percentile - winzeler_3D7_gametocyte', 'Strain 3D7', 'percentile - winzeler_3D7_MAC', 'Strain 3D7 (MACS-purified)', ps.name) AS term FROM apidb.profileSet ps WHERE ps.name IN ('percentile - winzeler_3D7_MAC', 'percentile - winzeler_3D7_gametocyte','percentile - winzeler_NF54_gametocyte')

sqlQuery.name: winzAsexualSample
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as term FROM apidb.profileelementname pen WHERE pen.profile_set_id = '$$profileset_generic$$' AND NOT pen.name = 'Gametocyte' ORDER BY pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: GlExprStudiesStress
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name || ' vs. Control' as display, ps.name FROM apidb.profileelementname pen,apidb.profileset ps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.name in ('Stress Response profiles by temperature or varying DTT concentrations', 'Stress Response profiles by varying DTT incubation time') and pen.name != 'Control'

sqlQuery.name: GlExprStudiesStressPct
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT term, internal, REPLACE(term, 'red percentile - ','') as display FROM( SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'red percentile - Stress Response profiles by temperature or varying DTT concentrations' UNION SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'red percentile - Stress Response profiles by varying DTT incubation time' )

sqlQuery.name: GlTroellCCStudy
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Cell Cycle' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'Troell Cell Cycle'

sqlQuery.name: GlTroellCCStudyPct
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Cell Cycle' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'percentile - Troell Cell Cycle'

sqlQuery.name: GlExprStudiesEncyst
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Hehl encystation' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'Hehl Encystation Expression'

sqlQuery.name: GlExprStudiesEncystPct
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT p.name as term, p.profile_set_id as internal, 'Hehl encystation' as display FROM apidb.profileset p WHERE p.name = 'red percentile - Hehl Encystation Expression'

sqlQuery.name: GlExpressionSamplesEncyst
sqlQuery.sql: select pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, ps.name as parentTerm, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps where ps.name = 'Hehl Encystation Expression' and pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: ringqvistSample
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profileset ps WHERE pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id AND ps.name = 'Host Parasite Interaction' order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: ringqvistStudy
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ps.name as term, ps.profile_set_id as internal, ps.name as display FROM apidb.profileset ps WHERE ps.name = 'Host Parasite Interaction'

sqlQuery.name: ringqvistStudyPct

sqlQuery.name: cortesTranscriptPctD10
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ps.name as term, ps.profile_set_id as internal, substr(ps.name,(instr(ps.name,':',1)+2)) as display FROM apidb.profileset ps WHERE ps.name like 'percentile - Cortes Transcript Variantome%D10% :%'

sqlQuery.name: cortesCGH
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ps.name as term, ps.profile_set_id as internal, ps.name as display FROM apidb.profileset ps WHERE ps.name = 'Cortes CGH Profiles'

sqlQuery.name: cortesCGHSamples
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name || ' vs. Reference (3D7-A)' as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen,apidb.profileset ps WHERE pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.name = 'Cortes CGH Profiles' order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: cortesAllStrainsSamples
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct Replace(pen.name,'_',',') as display, pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, CASE WHEN pen.name in ('3D7-A','3D7A','10G','1_2B','W41') THEN '3D7-A derived' WHEN pen.name in ('3D7-B','3D7B') THEN '3D7-B derived' WHEN pen.name in ('7G8','KG7','LD10','WE5','ZF8') THEN '7G8 derived' WHEN pen.name in ('D10','E3','F1','G2','G4') THEN 'D10 derived' WHEN pen.name in ('AB10','AB6','HB3A') THEN 'HB3A derived' WHEN pen.name in ('BB8','BC4','HB3B') THEN 'HB3B derived' END as parentTerm from apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profile tpp, apidb.profileset tpps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ and tpps.profile_set_id = tpp.profile_set_id and tpps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id UNION select scgroup.name as display, scgroup.name as term, -1 as internal, '3D7 derived' as parentTerm from ( select '3D7-A derived' as name from dual union select '3D7-B derived' as name from dual )scgroup, apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profile tpp, apidb.profileset tpps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ and tpps.profile_set_id = tpp.profile_set_id and tpps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id and pen.name in ('3D7-A','3D7A','10G','1_2B','W41','3D7-B','3D7B') UNION select scgroup.name as display, scgroup.name as term, -1 as internal, 'HB3 derived' as parentTerm from (select 'HB3A derived' as name from dual union select 'HB3B derived' as name from dual )scgroup, apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profile tpp, apidb.profileset tpps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ and tpps.profile_set_id = tpp.profile_set_id and tpps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id and pen.name in ('AB10','AB6','HB3A','BB8','BC4','HB3B') UNION select parent.name as display, parent.name as term, -1 as internal, '' as parentTerm from ( Select CASE WHEN pen.name in ('3D7-A','3D7A','10G','1_2B','W41','3D7-B','3D7B') THEN '3D7 derived' WHEN pen.name in ('AB10','AB6','HB3A','BB8','BC4','HB3B') THEN 'HB3 derived' WHEN pen.name in ('7G8','KG7','LD10','WE5','ZF8') THEN '7G8 derived' WHEN pen.name in ('D10','E3','F1','G2','G4') THEN 'D10 derived' END as name from apidb.profileset ps, apidb.profileelementname pen, apidb.profile tpp, apidb.profileset tpps where pen.profile_set_id = ps.profile_set_id and ps.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ and tpps.profile_set_id = tpp.profile_set_id and tpps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id) parent

sqlQuery.name: HalfLifeStage
sqlQuery.sql:
select pen1.profile_element_name_id || ',' || pen2.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen1.name as term, decode(pen1.name,'R','Ring','T','Trophozoite', 'S', 'Schizont', 'LS', 'Late Schizont') as display from apidb.profileelementname pen1,apidb.profileset ps1, apidb.profileelementname pen2,apidb.profileset ps2
where ps1.profile_set_id = pen1.profile_set_id and ps1.name = 'Profiles of Derisi HalfLife-half_life' and ps2.profile_set_id = pen2.profile_set_id and ps2.name = 'Profiles of Derisi HalfLife-std_dev' and pen1.name = pen2.name order by pen1.element_order

sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, name as display from apidb.profileset where name = 'Expression profiling of T. gondii strains'

sqlQuery.name: CryptoRtPcrTimesPoints
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen where pen.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ ORDER BY pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: TschudiTbruceiRnaSeq
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen where pen.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic$$ ORDER BY pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: LifeCycStgTbruceiRnaSeqRef
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, 'Uninduced sample' as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen where pen.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic_coverage$$ and pen.name in ('No_Tet')

sqlQuery.name: LifeCycStgTbruceiRnaSeq
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.name as term, pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, CASE WHEN (pen.name = 'PF') THEN 'Induced procyclics' WHEN (pen.name = 'BFD3') THEN 'Induced bloodstream form (day 3)' WHEN (pen.name = 'BFD6') THEN 'Induced bloodstream form (day 6)' WHEN (pen.name = 'DIF') THEN 'DIF (induced throughout growth) form' || to_char(chr(185)) END as display FROM apidb.profileelementname pen where pen.profile_set_id = $$profileset_generic_coverage$$ and pen.name in ('BFD3','BFD6','DIF','PF') order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: ScTimeSeriesProfiles
sqlQuery.sql: Select name as term, profile_set_id as internal, lower(replace(name, 'Expression profiling of saccharomyces cerevisiae s288c ', '')) as display from apidb.profileset where name like '%saccharomyces%'

sqlQuery.name: ExperessionPecentileSamplesBoothroyd
sqlQuery.sql: Select pen.profile_element_name_id as internal, pen.name as term, pen.name as display from apidb.profileelementname pen,apidb.profileset ps where ps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id and ps.name = 'percentile - Expression profiles of Tgondii ME49 Boothroyd experiments' order by pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: MetabolicPathways
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT dr.primary_identifier AS internal, TRIM(REPLACE(decode(dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier, null, dr.primary_identifier, dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier), CHR(191),'')) AS display, dr.primary_identifier AS term FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed, dots.DbRefNaFeature drnf, ApidbTuning.GeneAttributes gf WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name in ('pfal3D7_dbxref_simple_gene2HagaiPathway_RSRC','tgonME49_dbxref_protein2Pathways_Feng_RSRC') AND dr.primary_identifier != 'qualityControl' AND drnf.db_ref_id = dr.db_ref_id AND gf.na_feature_id = drnf.na_feature_id AND gf.organism = $$org_with_Hagai_pathways$$ ORDER BY display

sqlQuery.name: phenotype
sqlQuery.sql: select display,term,internal,parentTerm from ( select go_term || ' (' || count(distinct gene) || ')' as display, replace(go_term, ',', '-') as term, go_term as internal, '' as parentTerm,count(distinct gene) as order_num from apidb.SIRNA, ApidbTuning.GeneAttributes ga where gene = ga.source_id group by go_term union select pato_term || ' (' || count(distinct gene) || ')' as display,go_term || pato_term as term, go_term || pato_term as internal, replace(go_term, ',', '-') as parentTerm, count(distinct gene) as order_num from apidb.SIRNA, ApidbTuning.GeneAttributes ga where gene = ga.source_id group by pato_term, go_term) order by order_num desc

sqlQuery.name: MinMaxAvgComp
sqlQuery.sql: select * from ( select term || p.so as term, internal,display, p.so from ( select 'average' as term, 'average' as internal, 'average' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = 'abs' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual union select 'minimum' as term, 'minimum' as internal, 'minimum' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = '-' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual union select 'maximum' as term, 'maximum' as internal, 'maximum' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = '+' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual ) p, ( select 'abs' as type from dual union select '+' as type from dual union select '-' as type from dual ) t, ( select 1 as so from dual union select 2 as so from dual union select 3 as so from dual ) o where p.so = o.so and type = '$$regulated_dir$$' order by p.so ) where '$$regulated_dir$$' != 'abs' OR ('$$regulated_dir$$' = 'abs' AND term like 'average%')

sqlQuery.name: MinMaxAvgRef
sqlQuery.sql: select * from ( select term || p.so as term, internal,display, p.so from ( select 'average' as term, 'average' as internal, 'average' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = 'abs' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual union select 'minimum' as term, 'minimum' as internal, 'minimum' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = '+' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual union select 'maximum' as term, 'maximum' as internal, 'maximum' as display, CASE WHEN '$$regulated_dir$$' = '-' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END as so from dual ) p, ( select 'abs' as type from dual union select '+' as type from dual union select '-' as type from dual ) t, ( select 1 as so from dual union select 2 as so from dual union select 3 as so from dual ) o where p.so = o.so and type = '$$regulated_dir$$' order by p.so ) where '$$regulated_dir$$' != 'abs' OR ('$$regulated_dir$$' = 'abs' AND term like 'average%')

sqlQuery.name: MinMaxAvgMed
sqlQuery.sql: select 'average' as term, 'average' as internal, 'average' as display from dual union select 'minimum' as term, 'minimum' as internal, 'minimum' as display from dual union select 'maximum' as term, 'maximum' as internal, 'maximum' as display from dual union select 'median' as term, 'median' as internal, 'median' as display from dual

sqlQuery.name: HornRNAiSeqProfiles

sqlQuery.name: SpliceSiteExperiment
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ed.name as term, edr.external_database_release_id as internal, ed.name as display FROM sres.externaldatabase ed, sres.externaldatabaserelease edr WHERE ed.name like '%Spliced_Leader_rnaSeqSplicedLeaderAndPolyASites_RSRC' AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id

sqlQuery.name: SpliceSiteSample
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct sample_name as term, sample_name as internal, sample_name AS display FROM apidb.SpliceSiteGenes WHERE external_database_release_id = $$splice_site_generic$$ AND sample_name not like '%Alba%' ORDER BY sample_name

sqlQuery.name: SamplesWithMetaDataTest
sqlQuery.sql:
with metadata_values as ( select distinct Pen.Profile_Element_name_Id As Pen_Id, pen.name as name, bmc.value || ' (' || oe.value || ')' as value, to_char(REGEXP_REPLACE(bmc.value,'[^0-9]',''),'09999') nums, case when Oe.Ontology_Entry_Id = $$profile_ontology_1$$ then 1 else 2 end as order_num
from study.biosample bm, STUDY.biomaterialcharacteristic bmc, STUDY.ontologyentry oe, Study.Study S, Apidb.Profileset Ps, Apidb.Profileelementname pen, Rad.Studybiomaterial Sbm where bm.bio_material_id = bmc.bio_material_id and bmc.ontology_entry_id =oe.ontology_entry_id and bmc.value is not null and Oe.Ontology_Entry_Id in ($$profile_ontology_1$$,$$profile_ontology_2$$) and Ps.External_Database_Release_Id = S.External_Database_Release_Id And S.Study_Id = Sbm.Study_Id And Bm.Bio_Material_Id = Sbm.Bio_Material_Id And Bm.Name = Pen.Name and ps.profile_set_id= $$profileset_generic$$ and pen.profile_set_id= $$profileset_generic$$ order by pen_id), metadata_agged_values as ( select pen_id, name, LISTAGG(mv.value, ' >> ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY order_num asc) value, LISTAGG(nums, '') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY order_num asc) nums from metadata_values mv group by pen_id, name ) select distinct display, term, Internal, parentTerm, Chars, nums, node_level from ( select distinct '' as parentTerm, value as term, value as display, -1 as internal, Regexp_Replace(value,'[0-9]','') As Chars, to_number(replace(nums,' ','')) nums, 0 as node_level from metadata_agged_values union select distinct value as parentTerm, name as term, name as display, pen_id as internal, Regexp_Replace(value,'[0-9]','') As Chars, to_number(replace(nums,' ','')) nums, 1 as node_level from metadata_agged_values ) order by node_level,nums,chars

sqlQuery.name: SamplesMetadata
sqlQuery.sql: With categories as ( Select Oe.Ontology_Entry_Id From Study.Study S, Apidb.Profileset Ps, Rad.Studybiomaterial Sbm, Study.Biomaterialcharacteristic Bmc, Study.Ontologyentry oe Where Ps.External_Database_Release_Id = S.External_Database_Release_Id And S.Study_Id = Sbm.Study_Id And Bmc.Bio_Material_Id = Sbm.Bio_Material_Id And Bmc.Ontology_Entry_Id = Oe.Ontology_Entry_Id And Ps.Profile_Set_Id in ( $$profileset_generic$$ ) Group by Oe.ontology_entry_id having count(distinct BMC.value) >1 ) select distinct pen.name as term, case when regexp_like(bmc.value,'^([0-9])+\s([^0-9])+$') then (regexp_replace(bmc.value,'\s[^0-9]+','')) else bmc.value end as value, oe.value as property from study.biosample bm, STUDY.biomaterialcharacteristic bmc, STUDY.ontologyentry oe, Study.Study S, Apidb.Profileset Ps, Apidb.Profileelementname pen, Rad.Studybiomaterial Sbm, categories c where bm.bio_material_id = bmc.bio_material_id and bmc.ontology_entry_id =oe.ontology_entry_id and c.ontology_entry_id = bmc.ontology_entry_id and bmc.value is not null and Ps.External_Database_Release_Id = S.External_Database_Release_Id and S.Study_Id = Sbm.Study_Id and Bm.Bio_Material_Id = Sbm.Bio_Material_Id and Bm.Name = Pen.Name and ps.profile_set_id in ($$profileset_generic$$) and pen.profile_set_id in ($$profileset_generic$$)

sqlQuery.name: SamplesMetadataSpec
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT 'Age' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'number' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Age' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'range' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Age' as property, 'units' as spec_property, 'years' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Age' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'Age' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'DiseaseState' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'string' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'DiseaseState' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'membership' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'DiseaseState' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'Disease State' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'SamplingTimePoint' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'string' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'SamplingTimePoint' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'membership' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'SamplingTimePoint' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'Sampling Time Point' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Sex' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'string' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Sex' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'membership' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Sex' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'Sex' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'iPCR_Result' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'string' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'iPCR_Result' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'membership' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'iPCR_Result' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'iPCR Result' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'time_to_onset' as property, 'type' as spec_property, 'number' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'time_to_onset' as property, 'filter' as spec_property, 'range' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'time_to_onset' as property, 'units' as spec_property, 'days' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT 'time_to_onset' as property, 'display' as spec_property, 'Time To Onset' as spec_value FROM dual UNION SELECT value as property, 'description' as spec_property, NVL(definition, '') as spec_value FROM STUDY.ontologyentry WHERE value in ('Age', 'DiseaseState', 'SamplingTimePoint', 'Sex', 'iPCR_Result', 'time_to_onset')

sqlQuery.name: TextFields
sqlQuery.sql: select field_name as internal, case field_name when 'Blastp' then 'Similar proteins (BLAST hits v. NRDB/PDB)' when 'CellularLocalization' then 'Cellular localization' when 'EcNumber' then 'EC descriptions' when 'GeneId' then 'Gene ID' when 'Notes' then 'Gene notes' when 'PreviousReleaseGenes' then 'Genes of previous release' when 'Product' then 'Gene product' when 'GoTerms' then 'GO terms and definitions' when 'MetabolicPathways' then 'Metabolic pathway names and descriptions' when 'InterPro' then 'Protein domain names and descriptions' when 'RodMalPhenotype' then 'Rodent malaria phenotype' when 'Comments' then 'User comments' when 'CommunityAnnotation' then 'Community annotation' else field_name end as term from (select field_name from ApidbTuning.GeneTextSearch union select 'Blastp' as field_name from dual union select 'Comments' as field_name from dual union select 'CommunityAnnotation' as field_name from ApidbTuning.GeneTextSearch where project_id in ('ToxoDB', 'GiardiaDB')) order by term
